id.description: The id of the law that you are searching

poc.description: Include points of contacts in the return value.

expired.description: The 'true' value returns a record no matter its status (current, expired, archived, or repealed). The default 'false' value returns only current laws and incentives.

$ul: **inputs**: The parameters that were passed to the API
**metadata**: The identifying metadata.
**count**: If the request returns an array of results, this is the number of results returned in the array
**version**: This is the version of the api
**result**: This is a Law
**agency**: The agency with primary responsibility for federal incentives/regulations.
**amended_date**: The date the incentive/law/regulation was updated through new legislation or rulemaking.

**archived_date**: The date that an incentive/law/regulation is no longer relevant to the database. This may include longstanding Executive Orders or laws requiring legislative studies that have been completed.
**categories**: The various law categories that apply to this law
**contacts**: The contacts for the given law, returned only if the parameter poc is true
**enacted_date**: The date the enacting legislation (if applicable) was signed into law.
**expired_date**: The date the incentive/law/regulation is set to end.
**id**: A unique identifier for this specific incentive/law/regulation.
**is_recent**: The true or false value used to distinguish between recent federal executive actions (TRUE) and active incentives/laws/regulations (FALSE).
**plaintext**: Description of the incentive/law/regulation, including applicable legislative references, in markdown formatting
**recent_update_or_new**: An indicator if the last significant update was an update or the laws creation.
**references**: The URL associated with any bill or legislative reference included in the description.
**repealed_date**: The date legislation is enacted or a rulemaking is finalized to repeal the incentive/law/regulation.
**seq_num**: The numerical value assigned to a description to show the order in which it is displayed online within a jurisdiction (state).
**significant_update_date**: When the last significant update to the law was made.
**state**: The state in which the incentive/law/regulation was enacted and is active.
**text**: Description of the incentive/law/regulation, including applicable legislative references, html formated.
**title**: The brief title assigned to the incentive/law/regulation description.

**topics**: For local incentive/regulation descriptions, the category that the incentive/regulation falls under, described below: Infrastructure Requirements, Vehicle Purchase and Infrastructure Development Incentives, Fuel Use Incentives, Parking Incentives, Technical Assistance, Vehicle Acquisition Requirements, Promotion Initiatives, Idle Reduction Requirements, Renewable Fuels Mandates and Standards
**type**: The category that the incentive/law/regulation falls under, described below: -State Incentives, -Laws and Regulations, -Utility/Private Incentives
**types**: The types that apply to this law
